required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of Dapagliflozin in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycaemic Control on Background Combination of Metformin and Sulfonylurea
clinical_study.official_title: A 24-week, Multicentre, Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, International Phase III Study With a 28-week Extension Period to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Dapagliflozin 10mg Once Daily in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycaemic Control on a Background Combination of Metformin and Sulfonylurea

brief_summary.textblock: This study intends to compare the efficacy and safety of dapagliflozin versus placebo in patients with type 2 diabetes who have inadequate glycaemic control on a background combination of metformin and sulfonylurea.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in HbA1c Levels
primary_outcome.description: To compare the change from baseline in HbA1c to week 24 between dapagliflozin 10 mg in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea and placebo in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in FPG
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the change from baseline in fasting plasma glucose (FPG) to week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Total Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the change from baseline in total body weight to week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With HbA1c Value < 7.0% at Week 24 (LOCF)
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the proportion of subjects achieving a therapeutic glycemic response, defined as HbA1c <7.0%, at week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the change from baseline in seated systolic blood pressure (SBP) to week 8 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

intervention.description: 10 mg tablet, oral, once daily, 24- week treatment and 28- week extension period
matching placebo tablet, oral, once daily, 24- week treatment and 28- week extension period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Men or women age ≥ 18 years old
- Stable dose combination of metformin and sulfonylurea
- HbA1c ≥7.7% and ≤11.0%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus or diabetes insipidus
- Recent cardiovascular events
- Kidney or urological disorders
- Hepatic disorders

overall_official.last_name: Eva Johnsson, PhD, Medical Science Director
overall_official.affiliation: AstraZeneca R&D, Global Medicines Development CVGI, SE-431 83 Mölndal, Sweden

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First participant enrolled: 24 Oct 2011. Last participant completed 24 week period: 07 Jan 2013. 311 participants were enrolled, 219 were randomized in 45 centers in 5 European countries and in North America. Men and women aged >= 18 years with inadequate glycemic control (HbA1c 7.0% to 10.5% prior to randomization).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During enrollment, diet and life-style advice was given to participants and was reinforced during a placebo lead-in period. Dose of anti-hyperglycemic combination therapy of metformin >= 1500 mg/day and maximum tolerated dose which must be at least half the maximum dose of sulfonylurea for at least 8 weeks prior to enrollment were to remain stable.

group.title: Placebo Plus Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea
group.description: Placebo once daily plus background combination of metformin and sulfonylurea

group.title: Dapagliflozin 10mg Plus Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea
group.description: Dapagliflozin 10mg once daily plus background combination of metformin and sulfonylurea

baseline.population: Full Analysis Set defined as all randomized participants (as randomized) who received at least one dose of study medication during the 24-week short-term double blind treatment period who have a non-missing baseline value and at least one post-baseline value for at least one efficacy variable to be analyzed at week 24.

group.title: Placebo Plus Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea
group.description: Placebo once daily plus background combination of metformin and sulfonylurea

group.title: Dapagliflozin 10mg Plus Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea
group.description: Dapagliflozin 10mg once daily plus background combination of metformin and sulfonylurea

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in HbA1c Levels
outcome.description: To compare the change from baseline in HbA1c to week 24 between dapagliflozin 10 mg in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea and placebo in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, participants with non-missing baseline and week 24 values

group.title: Placebo Plus Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea
group.description: Placebo once daily plus background combination of metformin and sulfonylurea

group.title: Dapagliflozin 10mg Plus Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in HbA1c Levels
measure.description: To compare the change from baseline in HbA1c to week 24 between dapagliflozin 10 mg in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea and placebo in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, participants with non-missing baseline and week 24 values

analysis.groups_desc: H0: mean(treat) minus mean(placebo) = 0 versus the alternative HA: mean(treat) minus mean(placebo) =/= 0
analysis.p_value_desc: Significant at alpha=0.05 (2-sided). A hierarchical closed testing procedure was used to control Type I error across the primary & key secondary objectives
analysis.method_desc: Longitudinal repeated measures model using mixed model with treatment group, baseline value, week and week*treatment and week*baseline

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in FPG
outcome.description: To compare the change from baseline in fasting plasma glucose (FPG) to week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, participants with non-missing baseline and week 24 (LOCF) values

analysis.p_value_desc: Significant at alpha=0.05 (2-sided). A hierarchical closed testing procedure was used to control Type I error across the primary & key secondary objectives
analysis.method_desc: with treatment group as effect and baseline value as covariate

measure.title: Proportion of Participants With HbA1c Value < 7.0% at Week 24 (LOCF)
measure.description: To compare the proportion of subjects achieving a therapeutic glycemic response, defined as HbA1c <7.0%, at week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, participants with non-missing baseline and week 24 (LOCF) values

analysis.groups_desc: H0: proportion(treat) minus proportion (placebo) = 0 versus the alternative HA: proportion (treat) minus proportion (placebo) =/= 0
analysis.p_value_desc: Significant at alpha=0.05 (2-sided). A hierarchical closed testing procedure was used to control Type I error across the primary & key secondary objectives
analysis.method_desc: Based on methodology of Zhang, Tsiatis & Davidian and Tsiatis, Davidian, Zhang & Lu, with adjustment for baseline value

reported_events.time_frame: Non-serious / serious adverse events on or after the first day and on or prior to the last day of the 24-week double-blind treatment plus 4/30 days or up to follow-up visit if earlier, or up to and including the start date of extension period if earlier.
reported_events.desc: Participants were questioned at each study visit about the occurrence of any health problems and any examination conducted at a study visit was assessed in comparison to the status at study entry.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If an Investigator requests permission to publish data from this study any such publication is to be agreed with AstraZeneca (AZ) in advance. The investigator agrees to provide AZ as soon as possible with drafts of proposed publications. Unless otherwise agreed, AZ shall have a period of 60 days from receipt of the proposed final manuscript to review it and may within such time require that submission for publication of the manuscript be delayed in order for AZ to file patent applications.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: For participants who did not complete 8 and/or 24 weeks, respectively, last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for analyses of secondary endpoints. All endpoints were evaluated by excluding data after rescue.
